name: Cherubim
blurb: Heavenly guardians stationed at Eden’s eastern gate with a flaming sword. They mark that re-entry to God’s presence is barred except by His provision, foreshadowing later tabernacle/temple symbolism.
searchText: cherubim group narrative heavenly guardians stationed at eden’s eastern gate with a flaming sword. they mark that re-entry to god’s presence is barred except by his provision, foreshadowing later tabernacle/temple symbolism.

name: Tarshish
blurb: Descendant of Javan; part of the Japhethite branch associated with maritime and northern peoples.
searchText: tarshish person genealogy descendant of javan; part of the japhethite branch associated with maritime and northern peoples.

name: Sheba (Joktan)
blurb: Son of Joktan; associated with Arabian regions and trade.
searchText: sheba (joktan) person genealogy son of joktan; associated with arabian regions and trade.

name: Ophir
blurb: Son of Joktan; associated with Arabian regions and trade.
searchText: ophir person genealogy son of joktan; associated with arabian regions and trade.

name: Sheba (Jokshan)
blurb: Descendant of Jokshan; branch of Abraham’s Keturah-line.
searchText: sheba (jokshan) person genealogy descendant of jokshan; branch of abraham’s keturah-line.

name: Glory-cloud filling the tabernacle
blurb: Visible sign of divine indwelling that guides Israel’s journeys.
searchText: glory-cloud filling the tabernacle figure narrative visible sign of divine indwelling that guides israel’s journeys.

name: Glory of the LORD
blurb: Appears at the inauguration of worship; fire consumes the offering. Theophany confirms that atonement is God’s gift, not human achievement.
searchText: glory of the lord figure narrative appears at the inauguration of worship; fire consumes the offering. theophany confirms that atonement is god’s gift, not human achievement.

name: Solomon (son of David)
blurb: Royal figure anchoring the Song’s frame—owner of vineyards, bearer of the wedding crown, patron of wisdom and song (1 Kgs 4:32). He can be read as the bridegroom or as symbolic foil whose grandeur is relativized by the couple’s mutual love.
searchText: solomon (son of david) person royal royal figure anchoring the song’s frame—owner of vineyards, bearer of the wedding crown, patron of wisdom and song (1 kgs 4:32). he can be read as the bridegroom or as symbolic foil whose grandeur is relativized by the couple’s mutual love.
